The computational cost of DIA and ANS [
] is determined by the number of times of the
calculations of the potential energy. For a systemconsisting of hundreds of atoms [
partitions conﬁguration space into at least 10
subdivisions, and in each subdivision, more than 3
conﬁgurations should be randomly produced to be calculated for the total potential energy, and the

The approach developed in the last section was ﬁrst demonstrated by calculating the PF for a piece
c) sheet of 510 C atoms on the (111) surface of a Cu
substrate of 2640 atoms located in perfect fcc lattices. Brenner potential was employed to characterize
